content.description: An advertisement firm reports that the proportion of consumers who respond favorably to a certain advertisement is 0.70. Three simulations, A, B, and C, were designed to create a sampling distribution of a sample proportion from a population with proportion 0.70. Each simulation consisted of 2,500 trials. For each trial of a simulation, a sample of size <math alttext="n" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> was selected at random, and the sample proportion was recorded. The value of <math alttext="n" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> varied among the simulations. The following histograms summarize the results of the simulations.
content.question: Which of the following lists the simulations in order from the least sample size <math alttext="n" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> to the greatest sample size <math alttext="n" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: Simulation A, simulation B, simulation C
Simulation A, simulation C, simulation B
Simulation B, simulation A, simulation C
Simulation B, simulation C, simulation A
Simulation C, simulation A, simulation B

content.answer: Simulation A, simulation C, simulation B
